thread.title: This Melania Trump knockoff is making a killing
thread.title_full: This Melania Trump knockoff is making a killing | New York Post

author: Sarah Barns, The Sun
title: This Melania Trump knockoff is making a killing
text:
An Israeli model is raking in thousands of dollars by working as a Melania Trump lookalike.
Mira Tzur, 45, who is originally from Tel Aviv but is now based in New York, has played the part of the First Lady eight times, earning $3,000 per appearance.
She says she’s a big fan of Melania, 46, and her husband Donald Trump, 70, which makes her lucrative career even more enjoyable.
“I feel great admiration for both of them,” she told Miami Herald .
“That makes my job even easier.”
Tzur is often accompanied by her fake husband “Donald Trump” and has a number of special appearances coming up.
Despite the fact her hair is brown and she has a porcelain complexion, Tzur believes her accent closely resembles that of Slovenia-born Melania.
Speaking to Forward.com, Mira’s publicist explained that she first started appearing as the first lady when fellow impersonator John Di Domenico, who has been playing Trump for years, asked her to work alongside him in a video.
Mira Tzur Getty Images Tzur is now working on a business book for aspiring models after previously storming the catwalk herself in the past.
But Tzur isn’t the first Melania double – Czech-born Petra Svoboda’s sexy social media snaps have drawn comparisons with the first lady.
Melania Trump has been at the center of a media storm since her husband took the most high profile job in the world.
Donald Trump critics have claimed Melania “shuddered” when the president touched her shoulder after a speech.
Melania also appeared on the cover of Vanity Fair “munching on diamonds” as if they were a bowl of pasta.
